abstract: Wells Fargo, the fourth largest United States bank by assets, paid its chief executive, John Stumpf, compensation worth $21.3 million for 2009, a package that probably makes him the highest-paid American bank executive, according to materials filed with regulators.
snippet: Wells Fargo, the fourth largest United States bank by assets, paid its chief executive, John Stumpf, compensation worth $21.3 million for 2009, a package that probably makes him the highest-paid American bank executive, according to materials file...
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo, the fourth largest United States bank by assets, paid its chief executive, John Stumpf, compensation worth $21.3 million for 2009, a package that probably makes him the highest-paid American bank executive, according to materials filed with  regulators, Reuters reported.

headline.main: 2009 Paycheck for Wells’s Chief More Than Doubles
